item.name: 30 Carats
item.comment: Pas fait lunanimité car toutes nos gemmes avaient une valeur négative, mais moi j'ai énormément ri!! Les gens rejoueraient si on s'assure qu'il y a quelques positifs.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment: My very first modern board game and still a classic. A favorite of many of my friends.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Cities
item.wishlistcomment:
Second expansion for 7 Wonders. Optional team rules. A new type of card (black, representing city ruins). New cards of old types (two new wonders, new guild and leader cards associated with black cards).
30$ RB 29$ TMP (FR) 25$ IMG (FR) 22$ GG (EN)

item.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders
item.comment: 3 new guilds and 32 white "Leader" cards. 1 new Wonder board (the ancient city of Rome).
item.wishlistcomment: 30$ RB 29$ TMP (FR) 25$ IMG (FR) 22$ GG (EN)

item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
item.comment: Setup+rules: 15min Game: 1h
item.wishlistcomment:
"One play, but, I never laughed so hard in my life. It was just... one heck of a thrill with the potential for an awesome punchline at the end. A couple notes: I don't know if I could teach this game, and setting it up looks daunting. Almost like an arkham horror..." -Bippi
"Yet another game that I got to play with the kids, but have ended up really liking myself. Just a fun, fun game. I am a little concerned about the replayability. But for now, I like it a lot."
"Good, thematic game for those new to the board game scene. The game feels very much like an Indiana Jones adventure. Fun to start with, just not sure how much replayability the game has in it."
Bien aimé par Tom55 qui aime les même jeux que moi!
C'est mieux pyramid of horus selon le gars du randolph (moins de choses a retenir)
65$ TPM FR 65$ IMG FR EDITION REVISEE 50$ IMG EN REVISED EDITION 45$ TPM EN OoS 39$ GG EN

item.name: The Agents
item.comment: After my first play, I'm amazed by the depth, innovation and simplicity of this game. The double-edge of each card is a very interesting mechanic, but my mind can't seem to be able to come up with any good strategies for now... Although I've been told I had a particularly unlucky first game. Not sure it's the right kind of game for me anyway, but I'm willing to try it again!

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment:
The game drags too much and the lack of interaction makes it even more dull. Designing your own city is an interesting concept, but it can quickly become annoying instead of exciting. Max said: In a 6p game, you wait 10 minutes for your turn and when it's finally time to play, your best move might be to draw a card. And then you have to wait another 10 minutes. UGH!
It reminds of Jaipur somehow but Jaipur is much faster and fun!
item.wishlistcomment: City-building. Theme moyen-oriental. Acheter des buildings de différentes couleurs avec 4 monnaies d'échange différentes. Les 5 Expansions dans la Big Box ajoutent beaucoup de variantes. Interesting to me, but I don't think the theme would appeal much to my circle of friends.

item.name: Andor
item.wishlistcomment:
2 à 4 joueurs. Beau mais beaucoup de texte. Quetes en plusieurs étapes. Story-telling. Pas si bien quoté! Beaucoup plus simple qu'il n'y parait. Familial même! 15 minutes set-up. :/ Même illustrateur que Stone Age, Michael Menzel!
"However, there's one key mechanic in this game that really hurt our opinion of it. There are two normal conditions for losing a game; if too many monsters reach the castle, or if time runs out. However, every time you defeat a monster, time advances by one day. Defeating a monster is basically the WORST thing that can happen to you in the game. Aside from being incredibly unthematic, it also means that the game looks "tense", but the tension is entirely artificial - the monsters "score points" because you beat them! The game then centers around counting up and determining the number of monsters you can safely beat. Not only isn't this terribly exciting, but it means that in a game where maybe 80% of the mechanics focus on combat, each hero may only fight once or twice in a game. On top of that, the other main threat comes in the form of trial-and-error gameplay. You draw a card and it says "Oh, because you increased your strength too much, you LOSE!". When strength is normally good and you had no prior way of knowing that it would be bad in this scenario. Once you know about a trial-and-error element, you'll never do that again. If neither of those elements bother you, the rest of the game is quite enjoyable."
"Pandemic meets Talisman." Yuck.
Rahdo: "Arkham Horror for Euro fans". Epic and challenging.
Gab Gendron: "Moi mon dernier coup de coeur c'est Andor, jeu co-op incroyablement bien fait. Comme une bonne bouteille de vin, je le déguste à petite dose."
Acheter EN FRANCAIS OBLIGATOIREMENT.
59$ IMG EN (plus cher que FR? weird) 54$ IMG FR 49$ TPM 44$ MM EN 44$ GG 35$ Dragons FR

item.name: Ascension: Rise of Vigil
item.comment: I liked the game overall, but I felt there was too much randomness involved. You basically play whatever you can play for your turn and that's it. I'd like to have more power, a bigger range of possible actions.

item.name: BANG! The Bullet!
item.wishlistcomment: Un mix entre Resistance et Cash'n'guns.

item.name: Beowulf: The Movie Board Game
item.comment: I like the fact the game is divided into 3 rounds. It helps keeping track of everyone's score and also gives you a chance to adapt your strategy along the way. Perfect length (a little over 1h?). A great balance between strategy and simplicity. It pisses me off that it's missing more big attack (negative) moves to make it really shine, but like it nonetheless!

item.name: Bohnanza
item.wishlistcomment: SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ! 13-17$ IMG VF

item.name: The Builders: Middle Ages
item.comment: Un peu simple, mais intéressant. La personne la plus efficace gagne (avec un peu de chance).
item.wishlistcomment:
LAURIE L'A ACHETÉ! Les Bâtisseurs: Moyen-Âge en français.
X CotN 23$ IMG FR (OoS) 20$ TPM FR (OoS) 14$ GG EN

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: I had already played one game of Cash'n'Guns at a local Board Games Café and we had a blast. It's so simple but the fact you can goof around with the foam gun makes it extremely funny with the right people! Great as a gateway. *Max LOVED it!

item.name: Cacao
item.comment: Super simple à comprendre. Bien balancé. Rapide. Thème déjà vu. Actions intéressantes! (Les temples, les sources d'eau et les lieux de culte)

item.name: Carrière
item.comment: I really like the concept and flexible "set-your-own" goals at the beginning of the game. The game is old and without any artwork whatsoever, it's really dull to look at.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: There's some downtime on each turn, but aside from that, I love the strategy involved in the choice of character on each turn. I wish they used icons on the cards instead of text, something similar to 7 wonders.
item.wishlistcomment:
MICHAEL L'A ACHETÉ SHAUN VEUT L'ACHETER 2-7 joueurs. "With 5 it's a fun play, especially if you play to the fewer districs option. But once you get to 6 or 7, or try to play with that many people to max districts...UGH." À 7 joueurs c'est très risqué car trop long. Baisser les conditions de victoires. Les gens semblent aimer bcp. Bluffing! Un genre de Resistance, mais plus de stratégie. Plus de texte que je n'en voudrais sur les cartes par contre. Manque la simplicité des icones de 7 Wonders.
30$ RB VF + Dark City Exp. (coup de coeur) 30$ TPM VF + Dark City Exp. 30$ IMG VF + Dark City Exp. 19$ GG EN + Dark City Exp.

item.name: City of Horror
item.wishlistcomment:
Pas tres bien quoté?? 3 à 6 joueurs (+ possible) Tom Vasel capote. Un des meilleurs jeux de zombies selon lui. Survive as long as you can. Vote pour scarifier un joueur. Super beau gameboard.

Un mix entre Dixit et Kilucru.
On s'est trompé dans les règles, une seule personne peut doubler ses points par thème, ça l'a un peu brisé le déroulement de la partie alors Shaun a pas aimé ça.
Le système de points était pas super au point non plus.

LAURIE L'A ACHETÉ!
Un jeu familial assez simple où il faut faire devenir des mots out des phrases en utilisant une multitude de petits pictogrammes. Sympathique, mais peut-être un peu redondant à la longue?

item.name: Coup
item.comment: One guy in my weekly gaming group doesn't like bluffing games so it didn't quite work out, but I think I could have much fun with the right group AND more people (we were only four).
item.wishlistcomment:
Un genre de Love Letter en plus intense. :) COMPLOTS en français.
16$ IMG EN (OoS) 15$ IMG FR 15$ TPM FR 14$ CotN EN? (OoS) 13$ TPM EN (OoS)

item.name: Cranium Whoonu
item.comment: I like that it's short, but at the same time it's just way too simple for me. I added some variants to make it more fun, like "What would you bring on a deserted island?" but still, it gets old quickly. In the end, when I'm forced to play, I turn the switch to off and I play like a robot. :/

item.name: Cuba
item.comment:
30 minutes pour lire les règles. 2h pour jouer notre premiere partie a trois.
Un peu long dans l'ensemble mais surprenament facile a apprendre et le gameplay est très varié, on a tous beaucoup aimé. Il parait qu'il me faut absolument l'expansion EL PRESIDENTE!

Les gens qui aiment Funny Friends aiment aussi beaucoup ce jeu. Même illustrateur que Stone Age, Michael Menzel!
65$ IMG FR 46$ GG EN

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns
item.comment: We ended our first game early, it dragged. Nobody liked it.
item.wishlistcomment:
Sang Rancune en français.
38$ ARC FR

item.name: CV
item.comment: A LIFE + Career + Funny Friends mash-up! It really takes the best qualities out of these three games into a single streamlined game but unfortunately it's not perfect. It is gorgeous and quite well done, but there was a lack of tension/player interaction that could have elevated the game. A few icons/card design aspects could have been better in my opinion. Our first game was surprisingly long, I would have preferred a shorter playtime, but that might change on second play.
item.wishlistcomment: Rahdo: Dans son top 10 jeu thématique euro Style LIFE!

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment: I'm not very fond of "free-for-all conquer all" games, but I just loved Cyclades! I had played Small World many months ago and I hated it, but this one is brilliant and much deeper yet really simple. I think the auction is what makes this game really awesome. Not totally in love with the victory conditions though, it could probably be improved as it makes the obvious leader an almost automatic loser in the end. Should probably look for variants with improved victory conditions.
item.wishlistcomment:
SHAUN L'A VENDU!
Super bien quoté et populaire. Parait que c'est un genre de SmallWorld en vraiment mieux. Probleme de conditions de victoires. J'ai lu que l'extension reglait potentiellement le probleme?
"SmallWorld was just not controlling area like Cyclades can, no style and little substance in comparison. Cyclades has multiple paths to victory, minis, awesome artwork, sweet auctions, catch-up mechanisms..."
65$ TPM Multi 65$ IMG Multi OoS 54$ GG Multi OoS 40$ Dragons Multi

item.name: Dark Darker Darkest
item.comment:
Our first game was terrible. 1h30 to go over the rules once more before playing. 2h30 of "playing" (reading the rules, really.) Getting confused by contradicting and/or unclear sentences. Realizing we've had no fun after 4h invested in it. We all felt the game had potential, but the broken rulebook completely killed it. Also, my character was a firefighter and I really wish I could have lead the group and fight oncoming hordes of zombies. But instead, I was forced to stick with the group at all costs (quickly died of zombification the one time I stepped alone into an adjacent room) and do whatever little I could. Last thing: Ending your turn with action points left because of a lack of possible good moves in a race against the clock kind of game is extremely unsatisfying.
Game designer is passionate/determined enough to personally contact me about the revised rules, which I appreciate. Not sure when/if we'll ever give it another try, but I certainly appreciate the effort.
item.wishlistcomment: SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ!

item.name: Dead Man's Draw
item.comment: 7 player game worked like a charm with 2 boxes!

item.name: Dead of Winter: A la croisée des chemins
item.originalname: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
item.wishlistcomment:
En français SVP!
"Crossroads" is a new series from Plaid Hat Games that tests a group of survivors' ability to work together and stay alive while facing crises and challenges from both outside and inside.
Dead of Winter is a meta-cooperative psychological survival game. This means players are working together toward one common victory condition, but for each individual player to achieve victory, he must also complete his personal secret objective. This secret objective could relate to a psychological tick that's fairly harmless to most others in the colony, a dangerous obsession that could put the main objective at risk, a desire for sabotage of the main mission, or (worst of all) vengeance against the colony! Certain games could end with all players winning, some winning and some losing, or all players losing. Work toward the group's goal, but don't get walked all over by a loudmouth who's looking out only for his own interests!
Dead of Winter has players making frequent, difficult, heavily- thematic, wildly-varying decisions that often have them deciding between what is best for the colony and what is best for themselves.
Sortie prévue la première semaine de décembre 2014! X TPM 63$ IMG EN OoS 49$ GG EN OoS

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
item.wishlistcomment:
MICHAEL L'A ACHETÉ!
" The 2nd edition of Descent is great fun! The rules are streamlined. Big sprawling campaigns are broken down into encounters (each encounter taking 1 hr to play). It's alot like how the Pathfinder Card Game is broken down, nice short bursts. The original Descent was more clunky and took hours to finish. Also the hero player only needs to play 2 characters for it to be fun. It's not difficult at all. Since you like Runebound it's is in the same universe. You should look into it!" - comment on Youtube
"I have both HeroQuest and Descent. They are actually quite different to each other, although I love them both. Descent is a lot more strategic. You have a known map, and can make better-informed decisions about what you're going to do and why. Having an Overlord who actually plays, trying to achieve their own objective, is definitely very different. In Descent, the Overlord has a hand of cards they can play which changes things up. They have control over all their monsters from the beginning, and they have more interesting goals than just "kill the heroes". I think the artwork and combat system in Descent are both improvements upon HeroQuest. I don't know if you're familiar with any of the Diablo video games, but Descent felt similar to that (for me). I would say it was less like HeroQuest than I had expected, but that wasn't a bad thing. They're both games I rate highly!" -kyanna on BGG
Top 8 favorite game of Rahdo.
100$ ARC FR 95$ TPM FR (OoS) 93$ IMG FR 77$ TPM EN 73$ IMG EN 63$ GG En

[b]Teach time:[/b] 10 minutes (easy) [b]Playtime:[/b] 40-70minutes
I love this game. Everyone seems to have a great time. I've only had the chance to play the basic rules. Can't wait to try it with spells! But even just the basic version, it's already a great game in my opinion!
Update: I had one game with the advanced rules (spells) and it went well! Spells had some nice backstabbing opportunities, surprises and a little randomness. It works really well.

Un jeu de negociation Rpg-ish. Tuer des dragons avec nos héros puis partager le butin en 1minute entre les joueurs qui l'ont tués. Si on sentend pas, le butin est perdu!! Cartes pour plus de turn of events. Set collection. Doit jouer avec le BON groupe de joueurs. Coffret multilingues?

item.name: Eight-Minute Empire: Legends
item.comment:
[b]Teach time:[/b] 10-15min rules + setup (nothing too complicated) [b]Playtime:[/b] 30-45 minutes (4p game)
A Rattus for grown-ups. Much deeper but somewhat easier to strategize. The set collection mechanic coupled with the many paths to victory is SO well done. This game has ALOT to offer in such a tiny package. It's impressive and it looks very good. A great game!!

Ok en anglais (juste carte de personnage qui a 2 lignes de texte)

item.name: Elder Sign
item.comment:
We definitely found our first (2p) game tough. The rules weren't perfectly written so it wasn't clear what was allowed and what wasn't. Can't wait to see if the experience will differ with alot more players! Expecting more and more fun next times!
Second Time around: I am a little annoyed by missing rules. Difficulty changes quite a bit between games. Appreciating the strategy behind it. This game was way easier.
Theme is nice, but at the same time, it's not part of the gameplay at all. Its not as fun as we'd hoped it'd be.
item.wishlistcomment: Starlit Citadel Reviews: Version un peu simplifié (1-2h) du célèbre Arkham Horror. Fun, mais au final un peu répétitif car beaucoup de lancage de dés. Recommandé par énormément de gens. 34$ Imaginaire (anglais)(rupture stock) 26$ GermanGames

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
item.comment: The game comes with a soundtrack and I love it! It adds so much atmosphere. Narrative introduction to the game is a nice touch too. It's a real blast with 4-5 players! OMG! It's even fun alone! The silence is weird though I'm really surprised adults in their 50's can't stop playing it too, even though they're super stressed out! aha A must-have in my opinion. You have to be in the mood though!

Jeu qui se joue en 10 minutes (chronométré avec soundtrack (surprises)) A l'air super excitant!!! Fully cooperative. Assez simple à comprendre. I WANT IT! MAX WANTS IT SO MUCH!!

Finca

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: First 2p game was quite easy. (we won) First 4p game was tough as hell. (we lost with only 2 treasures) Did we make some really bad moves or is it unbalanced? It feels like you HAVE to follow a certain pattern of actions to win.
item.conditiontext: ENGLISH EDITION. Comes in a tin box. Like new.

Peut être un peu simple pour les joueurs avancés, mais fun. V.F. L'Ile Interdite. PAS TROUVÉ À QUÉBEC. 15-20$ en ligne.

item.name: HeroQuest
item.wishlistcomment: "I and my gaming group we never had more fun and nailbiting evenings/nights than with HeroQuest. We use the revised rules by Slev, which I can highly recommend. And you can find nearly endless quests and campaigns on the web." -Phantom07

item.name: Incan Gold
item.comment: Just plain fun with any kind of people. A great light party game with unexperienced family and friends. Might lack a little depth for the experienced gamers though.
item.wishlistcomment:
3-8 joueurs (5-8 best) Regarder vidéos. 2006 Golden Geek Award for Best Light/Party Game.
Enjoy exploring? Like to press your luck? Incan Gold is a quick, fun and tense game in which you and other adventurers explore an old Incan temple in search of gold and treasure. In each of the five rounds, you secretly choose if you want to continue exploring the temple in search of more treasure risking life and limb or retreat to the safety of your camp with your share of the treasure that has been discovered so far. Get too greedy, and you might lose all your hard-earned loot! Easy to learn and fun for young and old.
20$ TPM (VF) 19$ GG (EN)

item.name: Istanbul
item.comment:
Teach: 20min. Play: 50m-1h30
Despite the many icons and diversity of the modular board, the game is surprisingly easy to grasp and plays quickly (under 1h on my first 4p game.) Absolutely no Analysis Paralysis from any player. Fluid gameplay and great artwork.
Pleased with it so far.

item.name: Jaipur
item.comment:
This game has been on my wishlist FOREVER. There was a big sale at my local Toys'R'Us and this last copy of Jaipur was quite inexpensive. No second thought! :)
Jaipur is a fiiiiiiine game. It's only 2 players, so I don't play it much (I expected that at time of purchase), but when I do, I enjoy it very much. I just noticed many of my favorite games have the set collection mechanic!
item.wishlistcomment:
2 Joueurs seulement. Rapide, fun, fun, fun! "No necessary in-game text"
25$ RB 25$ Imaginaire (multilingue) 25$ TPM (VF?) 18$ GG (English?)

item.name: Jamaica
item.comment: Gorgeous game, but too simple. Too much luck involved. Also, not enough player interaction, especially with 3-4 players.
item.wishlistcomment: Très hot!! Super simple à comprendre! 2 à 6 joueurs = génial! Premier arrivé + de points, mais on doit compter l'or et les trésors! (certains sont maudits!) LOVE IT!

item.name: Jenga
item.wishlistcomment: X TPM X IMG X CoTN X GG

item.name: Jungle Speed
item.comment: Crazy, mais un peu dangereux! On a poké un mur à Mac et evité deux blessures de justesse.
item.wishlistcomment: MAC L'A ACHETÉ!

item.name: Kabuki
item.comment: A little long with 6 players. Not terribly exciting.

item.name: Keyflower
item.comment:
Au début j'ai badtrippé parce que trop d'actions possibles et toutes les actions peuvent être jouées de deux façons: acheter ou utiliser. Le jeu s'est placé au milieu de la partie quand ma stratégie est devenue claire. Un peu comme 7 wonders, le jeu devient vraiment intense en fin de partie car c'est la que ça se joue.
Beaucoup de similitudes avec 7 wonders et Stone age.
1h+ d'apprentissage 2h20 la première partie
item.wishlistcomment:
SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ! MEGA bien quoté!!! Super bien quoté par les joueurs qui adorent Robinson. Top X favorite game of Radoh.
"Really deserved! This game has it all: clever mechanics, excellent scalability from 2 to 6 players, a lot of interaction, replayability in spades. Not to mention the exceptionally cute artwork."

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment: A few years later... and I still consider this game a great purchase. It always seem to be a good fit in any kind of situation with any kind of players. An excellent game for sure.A few years later... and I still consider this game a great purchase. It always seem to be a good fit in any kind of situation with any kind of players. An excellent game for sure.
item.wishlistcomment: Bien quoté par mes amis. 38$ Imaginaire (VF) 35$ Imaginaire (EN) 33-37$? TPM (VF) 30$ GG (EN)

item.name: La Gloire de Rome
item.comment: Apprentissage: 45minutes Jeu: 1h30
item.wishlistcomment:
Shaun l'a acheté!
GAB Gendron aime full ça. Parait que dans le genre ça clanche Race for the Galaxy!
Acheter la version FILOSOFIA 35$ TPM VF OoS

item.name: Last Will
item.wishlistcomment:
2-5 joueurs. SUPER beau! Ça l'air vraiment l'fun!!! Il faut dpenser son argent like there's no tomorrow! Pas de texte, seulement des icones et simples (7 wonders). Bien quoté par mes amis. "No necessary in-game text"
X RB 45$ TPM (VF) 43$ IMG (EN) 36$ GG (EN)

item.name: Letters from Whitechapel
item.comment: Very nice game. Our first game was quite long (3h+) but nobody cared as we were all very focused and into it! It was almost perfect actually. Everyone loved it and I can't wait to play as an investigator (and for my friends to be Jack too!)
item.wishlistcomment:
Un genre de Cambriolage au Musée/Clue plus avancé. Intimidant au départ, mais pas compliqué quand on a compris. Full de suspense. Un des jeux préférés de Drakkenstrike en 2011. Suggeré par Liam Liam sur ma geeklist.
60$ IMG EN 45$ GG EN 39$ GG EN

item.name: Lewis & Clark
item.wishlistcomment:
JAMAICA + STONE AGE + AMERICAN HISTORY Interessant!
50$ ARC FR

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep
item.wishlistcomment:
47$ IMG EN (B/O) 42$ TPM EN
Expansion: Scoundrels of Skullport 40$ IMG EN (B/O) 37$ TPM EN

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
item.comment: Very pleased with this expansion! I feel it adds some tension between the players which was lacking a little in the base game.
item.wishlistcomment: X GG 40$ IMG EN 37$ TPM EN OoS

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment:
Only had a practice game so far, but it seems promising! I love that the strategies change as the game progresses.
Update: Had a 2p game as well as a game in teams of two. It worked surprisingly well and we had a great time!
item.wishlistcomment:
2 joueurs seulement. Jeux de carte super intéressant. Expedition (5 couleurs) coute 20 pts, cartes points (2 à 10), en ordre. Il faut prévoir le coup (carte multiplicatrices) et se spécialiser. Les gens qui aiment bcp Life The Card Game adorent ce jeu.
"Jaipur is much better. In LC, when the cards don't fall your way you're drawing dead for the rest of the hand and cursing your luck and the game. In Jaipur you can still hang tough and look for the play that will get you back in it."
Intéressant si pas cher! "No necessary in-game text!"
X RB X IMG 30$ TPM (FR) 19$ TPM (EN) 18$ GG (EN)

item.name: Lost Legends
item.comment: A great mix of 7 wonders and thunderstone. Pros: The game is quite deep (twice as deep as 7 wonders when you consider the combat phase) without being overly complicated (thanks in part to the well-thought iconography that helps smooth out the gameplay.) The artwork is also one of the best I've seen for this genre. Cons: The first (5p) game went on for more than 4 hours. Even though it was 1h30am in the end, nobody was sick of playing, so I guess it shows how much the game was appreciated though. The game could have a little more interaction between players. I'm worried having played a few times and knowing whats coming gives a huge advantage against newbie players.
item.wishlistcomment:
SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ!
"It's a mash-up of 7 Wonders and Thunderstone. It's more closely aligned with 7 Wonders. For the record, I like but do not love 7 wonders. I like but do not love Thunderstone. I loved my first play of Lost Legends. I felt there were many interesting decisions to make. I loved outfitting my character instead of building arbitrary buildings and doing science discoveries or whatever those green cards do in 7 Wonders. Lost Legends is much more thematic and the choices you make in drafting equipment for your character are fun and crucial to success. The game plays fast (an hour for the three player game including rules) but not too fast. You feel like you had the time to outfit and upgrade your character and bash monster skulls. Everything goes quick enough that you're not getting bored waiting on someone."
Vérifier comment les gens le comparent à Thunderstone.
29-40$ CotN 37$ GG EN 20$ Dragon

item.name: Love Letter
item.comment: Such a great game! It's extremely easy to learn, but not so easy to master. I'll bring it everywhere because it's compact AND appropriate for all game groups. It's also perfect as a late night game. And the price?! 8$ !!! It should be in everyone's collection!
item.wishlistcomment: IMG 10$ EN TPM 8$ EN? GG 7.50$ EN

item.name: Mage Knight Board Game
item.comment: The kind of game that could be a hit, but isn't because of the game group. I really feel like this game shines with 2 players. Unfortunately, I rarely play 2 players, we're usually 4, so it really didn't work out, it dragged too much.
item.wishlistcomment:
"Mage Knight is extremely difficult to learn, and games can last 3-4 hours plus, so again requires a gaming partner/s who will get into it with you. This one is the best solo game out there in my opinion though, so I'd highly recommend it if you plan to play solo ever. Definitely not for a laughter filled social evening though!"
"I saved the best for last... My personal Favorite Heavy Solo Game - This is a 10 in my book... It is a complex, challenging RPG Game with Hero leveling, map exploration, open world decisions, unit management, and a little bit of deck building. This game is not for the faint of heart. It takes a long time to play and setup."
Fulll bien quoté. Joue 1 à 4. 1h solo? 2h30-4h à plusieurs? Bcp d'éléments, pour joueurs expérimentés. Top 10 des jeux sur BGG. 75-80$ IMG EN 75$ TPM EN 60-61$ GG EN

item.name: Mascarade
item.comment: Mascarade est un jeu vraiment l'fun, mais son probleme c'est que même si tu sais que l'autre bluff, tu peux rien faire si t'as pas toi-même la bonne carte en main. En fin de partie, je savais qui possédait CHACUNE des 6 cartes autour de la table, mais je pouvais rien faire pour gagner... y'a un problème dans ce temps-là. :P
item.wishlistcomment:
Probleme de gameplay, lire commentaire.
25$ RB FR

item.name: Mille Bornes
item.comment: I really like the concept, it's simple but effective. The problem is, sometimes, you are forced to skip turns after turns because you can't get the right card. It does get frustrating when that happens.

item.name: Monopoly
item.comment: I don't think I ever completed a game of Monopoly in my whole life. This game either ends with "I don't care anymore" or "fuck this game".

item.name: No Thanks!
item.comment: I think I expected a little more out of No Thanks... I was expecting more Ah-AH! moments actually. We were 3 players for my first 2 games and I think it might be more fun with more players. I was browsing BGG No Thanks' forums and I just found out you can easily play up to 7 players (despite the official rules for max 5 players) so that's very good news. That game works well though, so, time will tell!
item.wishlistcomment:
Simple mais efficace! Rapide, facile. Parfait pour une mini game ou pour starter la soirée! Dans le top 10 ESSENTIEL de Tom Vasel. (#3)
14$ IMG VF (Commande speciale) 11$ GG (EN) 10$ TPM (VF Non Merci!)

item.name: L'osti d'jeu
item.comment: Initial rating: 8 Updated rating: 8.2
item.wishlistcomment: MAX L'A ACHETÉ!

item.name: Pandemic
item.wishlistcomment:
SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ!
Surprennament populaire. Une référence dans le style coop. Très bien quoté par mes amis. Challenging.
X RB 40-50$ IMG VF 40-45$ TPM VF 35$ IMG EN 35$ GG FR! 29$ GG EN

item.name: Panic on Wall Street!
item.wishlistcomment: SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ!

item.name: Parade
item.comment: Simple, mais très efficace! Le jeu est super beau et pas cher. Peut manquer un peu d’interaction.
item.wishlistcomment: JULIE ET MAC L'ONT ACHETÉS!

item.name: Pergamon
item.comment: I love this game's three (thematic) phases: push-your-luck for cash, the super-important digging phase to retrieve items and the collection display. It's elegantly designed.
item.wishlistcomment:
Intéressant. Beau. Thème unique. 2-4 joueurs seulement. Parfait pour 2. Trouver des artifacts, les acheter aux encheres, les présenter au musée pour récolter des points.
Voir discussion: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/890705/jamaica-or-pergamon
30$ TPM (VF?) 29$ GG (EN)

item.name: Petits Meurtres & Faits Divers
item.comment: MALAISE! Les mots a dire marchent pas (trop français, style fugace et gueuse)

item.name: The Phantom Society
item.comment: À fast-paced strategy game with a traditional feel to it, but with a modern theme and artwork. After 2 plays, the game seems tougher for the ghost team. The ghost team has to come up with very efficient strategies in order to have a chance to win, while basic logic seems enough as the hunter team. Need a few more plays to confirm!
item.wishlistcomment: SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ!

item.name: Prêt-à-Porter
item.comment:
Comments after first play: I prepared so much to be able to teach this game properly and have a smooth first game. The teaching part went well, but it's inevitable, as rulebook is unclear at times (botched translation + mistakes) you'll make a few mistakes along the way AND you'll have to go back to the rules to check what the cards are and what they do exactly. This made the game drag... It was quite long. I know second game will be a lot better, but it'll be hard to convince my friends to invest so much time in another round of this one. We have too many great games to try/play already.
I was ready to love this game so much though since I do work in fashion and I love worker placement. I guess I expected more fun in less time and with less mathematic.
Also, I believe the game would be THAT MUCH MORE enjoyable if it had great artwork. It's litterally screaming for great visuals!! Let's be honest here, the board, cards, icons and actual fashion designs look outdated and that's certainly not how you want your fashion game to look! The whole rules and graphic design needs to be revised completely.
item.wishlistcomment:
OMG a FASHION Board Game?! WANT!!
X IMG X TPM 49-50$ GG EN

item.name: Privacy
item.wishlistcomment:
Le fait de voter anonymement enlève un peu de fun au jeu, ça se veut "osé", mais c'est comme trop sage en même temps, surtout à beaucoup de joueurs.
Certaines questions sont plates.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: It's definitely an ugly duckling. The thing is: the ugly duckling is not bad! Reminds me of 7 wonders for some reason.
item.wishlistcomment:
SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ, Parait que dans le genre ça se fait clanché par Glory to Rome!
"Trying to keep track of those goofy & cryptic symbols was too much -- Glory to Rome streamlines the game play, but also broadens the tactical palette. SEE YA, RFTG!" - schlappy and 77 other gamers

item.name: Rattus
item.comment: An easy to learn, hard to master kind of game. It's quick, it's clever, it makes for a great gateway or first game of the night! I prefer 8-minute Empire Legends though!
item.wishlistcomment: SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ!

item.name: The Resistance: Avalon
item.comment: Impossible not to play 5 games in a row (at least!) It's easy to learn but hard to master. It's confusing, it's surprising, it's rewarding, it's genius! I LOVE this game!! Everyone does!
item.wishlistcomment: Party game Ranked 4! 5 à 10 joueurs. Un genre de Loups-Garous, sans modérateur. Un genre de saboteur sans les chemins et les cartes. Beaucoup de bluff, qui est gentil, qui est mechant, beaucoup de roles différents, j'adore!!! "Some necessary text" (très peu) 20$ IMG EN 18$ TPM 15$ GG

item.name: River Dragons
item.comment: The Turn planning is the mechanic I love, but it's a little too unpredictable since you have no idea what will happen or if you'll be blocked. Also, in games with an odd number of players, one player will be handicapped finding his own way to the other side.
item.wishlistcomment: Theme interessant, mais ça devient quasiment un jeu de dextérié à manipuler tous les petits morceaux. Je pense que je virerais fou à replacer les planches pour pas que'elles tombent.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
item.comment: The storytelling aspect of this game is genius. The board/cards look fantastic. It's my favorite game. It's a 10. It's perfect.
item.wishlistcomment:
Très intense, beaucoup de règles, mais semble très satisfaisant. Plusieurs types de scénarios, bonne rejouabilité. 12 tours pour accomplir X objectif donc gestion serrée. COOP. Survival. Chaque tour un nouvel obstacle à franchir. Max est intrigué, mais ne saura pas avant d'avoir essayé. Moi j'capote, ça l'air tellement le fun.
X RB 83$ IMG FR 75$ TPM FR 70$ IMG EN 65$ GG FR 57$ GG EN

item.name: Russian Railroads
item.comment:
Apprentissage long (1h) Jeu très long (2h30)
Même si le thème ne m'intéressait pas vraiment au départ, j'ai bien aimé le jeu. Beaucoup de choix et surtout beaucoup de tension (surtout vers la fin). J'ai moins aimé les frustrations occasionnées par les cases occupées par d'autres joueurs.

item.name: Santiago de Cuba
item.comment: A little too random for my taste. I didn't feel like I was "building something". There was no real strategy, I was just doing what was good at the moment.
item.wishlistcomment:
SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ!
35$ IMG EN 30$ GG EN

item.name: Seasons
item.wishlistcomment: I WANT IT! MAX WANTS IT! Très bien quoté par mes amis. 53$ TMP (VF) 50-57$ IMG (VF) 40$ TMP (EN) 39-52$ IMG (EN) 36$ GG (EN)

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse
item.comment:
Oh god... I can't explain clearly why I didn't like it, but I didn't like it. So much to keep track of.
I just hate it when my fights look like this: Ok, so... let me read this card... and this one... oh wait maybe this new skill I haven't read yet. Ok I'll attack with this one, let me read it to you... blah blah blah... ok so I have this other card that adds 2 damage to it... oh and let's not forget this superpower I have that could make it more powerful... but the vilain has a device that makes it immune and this power that reflects it to another target.... How much HP did you have left again? Hold on, let me call my accountant.
*Max quite liked it!
item.wishlistcomment: On a joué notre première partie au Randolph, recommandé par le gars de la place. Partie assez longue quand même, genre 1h30. Max dit que c'est son genre de jeu, il a beaucoup aimé. Moi je trouvais qu'il y avait beaucoup de texte et de choses à retenir. Le thème est pas full mon genre non plus.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment: LOVE LOVE LOVE this game. So much pressure. It's about finding out what the real priority is. Every player has a special ability. Big challenge! It's so much fun.
item.wishlistcomment:
SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ
120$ IMG VF + Expansion Merlin 80$ IMG VF 70$ ARC FR 50-60$ Dragons VF + Expansion Merlin

item.name: Shipwrights of the North Sea
item.comment:
Fun at first but then some things started annoying me/us: it got extremely hard to make plans since other players constantly sabotage you and it's not easy to turn your strategy around (you can even be completely blocked if you're not careful.)
Also, the game was way longer than expected: almost 2h30. It should be way shorter for what it is, in my opinion. The rules would benefit from some tweaking (more workers would definitely help speed up the game and adding the possibility to switch boats/workers to avoid being stuck for several turns would help counter the sabotages.)
item.wishlistcomment: SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ! (kickstarter)

item.name: Skull
item.comment: A little disappointed with Skull & Roses. I was expecting more out of it. Not sure I'll be playing it much. Might sell.
item.wishlistcomment:
Party Game! 3-6 joueurs, best with 5-6. Each player plays a face-down card, then each player in turn adds one more card... Until someone feels safe enough to state that he can turn a number of cards face up and get only roses. Other players can then overbid him, saying they can turn even more cards face up. The highest bidder must then turn that number of cards face up, starting with his own. If he shows only roses, he wins; if he reveals a skull, he loses, placing one of his cards out of play. Two succcessful challenges wins the game. That's all. Skull & Roses is not a game of luck; it's a game of poker face and meeting eyes.
20$ IMG (RED) 18$ IMG VF 17$ TPM (RED) 17$ TPM VF? 15$ GG EN

item.name: Small World
item.comment: I don't understand the Popularity of Small World. It's just placing tokens on a map, it makes me bored as hell.
item.wishlistcomment:
Very high replayability thanks to civilizations+special powers combinations. This game is quite mathematical though, theme didn't connect enough with actual gameplay. The goal is to invade the whole map, not to defeat other players one-on-one, which I would prefer.
57$ IMG (VF) 55$ IMG (EN) 55$ TMP (VF) 39$ GG (EN)

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment:
This game has everything I'm looking for in a game: beautiful artwork, original theme, ressources management, worker placement, strategy but not too mathematical/heavy. The only reason I did not give it a 10 is because I wish game length was a little shorter.
Update: Still one of my favorite games, and definitely on top of the Worker Placement genre. It's easy to teach, yet it doesn't feel too simple. I should bring it to the table more often!
item.wishlistcomment: Super beau. Quand même plusieurs éléments, mais semble bien fait et pas TROP difficile à expliquer. Un très bon gateway pour les joueurs semi-débutants. 55$ IMG (VF) 50$ TPM (VF) 38$ IMG (EN) 32$ GG (EN)

item.name: Sultans of Karaya
item.comment: Max quand même aimé, moi pas sûr.

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!
item.wishlistcomment: Intéressant! C'est un peu un free-for-all, chacun pour soi, mais parfois forcé à coopérer ou à détruire les autres. Le jeu est pas super super beau, mais pas si pire. Friendly-fun-family game. J'acheterais pour pas cher (15-20$ max) Très bien quoté par mes amis. "No necessary in-game text" 47$ TMP (VF) 42$ Imaginaire (EN) 29-30$ sur GermanGames

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! 5-6 Player Mini Expansion
item.comment: 9$ for plastic meeples and that's it? It should have been included in the base game, seriously.
item.wishlistcomment: 10$ BGG X RB 9$ IMG EN X TPM 7.50$ BGG 7-7.50$ GG EN

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! The Giant Squid Mini Expansion
item.wishlistcomment: 5$ BGG 5-6$ IMG EN X TPM 4.50-5$ GG EN

item.name: Sushi Go!
item.comment: Fun!

item.name: Takenoko
item.wishlistcomment:
LAURIE L'A ACHETÉ
Cute, mais un peu enfantin. Objectifs secrets. Concepteur de 7 Wonders.
50$ ARC FR

item.name: Talisman (third edition)
item.comment: It was fun the first few times, but it's definitely too long of a game. Some people get bored, everytime, because you just want it to finish and it won't since it's mostly luck-based. I don't play it anymore.

item.name: Terra Mystica
item.comment: 45m-60m per player. Setup is long. Hard to recall, have to reread the rules on replay.
item.wishlistcomment:
SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ! Area-control game. Très mathématique, mais theme interessant. Hex map. Beau, sans plus. Pas certains d'avoir les amis pour jouer à ça. Pas convaincu.
80$ ARC FR

item.name: Therapy
item.comment: Game is too long because of the luck factor when moving.

item.name: Thunderstone
item.wishlistcomment:
SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ!
Très similaire à Dominion semble-t-il. Mais parait que c'est mieux! Deck card building.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: OK, but clearly there's a lack of interaction between players, except for some blocking. Too much straightforward. Not quite into the theme either.
item.wishlistcomment: 60$ IMG FR 55$ TPM FR 53$ IMG EN 39$ GG EN

item.name: Timeline: Discoveries
item.comment: The theme of "discovery" just doesn't always work well with the main mechanic of the game, which is finding the creation year of X animal/landmark/phenomenon. It gets confusing for certain cards.

item.name: Tobago
item.wishlistcomment: SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ Il faut trouver des trésors sur une île, à l'aide d'indices donnés par leur joueur. Quand on trouve un trésor, le butin est distribué parmi les joueurs ayant fournis des indices. Il y a des trésors maudits et des amulettes. Sans capoter, j'ai bien aimé.

item.name: Tokaido
item.wishlistcomment:
LAURIE L'A ACHETÉ
Createur de 7 wonders. It's gooooooorgeous. Comme un 7 wonders, plus zen. Collect cards, block others. Plus facile à enseigner que 7 wonders.
52$ IMG FR 49$ TPM FR? 31$ GG EN

item.name: Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar
item.comment: WOW! Worker placement avec planification pour le futur. Pas si difficile à choisir. Toutes les stratégies sont bonnes. Intimidant, mais en bout de ligne pas tellement plus difficile que 7 wonders. On le compare à Trajan et Bora bora!
item.wishlistcomment:
SHAUN L'A ACHETÉ!
X RB 50$ IMG EN X TPM 44$ GG EN

item.name: Ulcers
item.comment: A very old game but it doesn't feel that old when we play. We still enjoy it at times!

item.name: Village
item.comment: Complexe a apprendre. Jaime le concept de temps qui passe. Plusieurs facons de gagner, mais malheureusement, pas aussi élégant/efficace que Stone Age.

item.name: WINK
item.comment: An excellent ice-breaker for casual gamers and parties. The game gets better with more players. A round table with equal distance between players is best.

item.name: Zombicide
item.comment:
PROS I really got the feeling we were fighting horde of zombies, for once! The fact you can really kill any of them with powerful weapons is very satisfying. I also liked the fact we could easily exchange weapons in order to balance players power (no weak player following behind the whole game.) Also, we had some freemdom: ie, we didn't have to stay on the exact same tile all of the game (as it was the case in Dark Darker Darkest).
CONS On the downside, I don't feel we had that many choices along the way. Also, I'm worried the game might not have a huge replayability.
Initial rating: 8.25 Updated rating: 8
item.wishlistcomment:
MICHAEL L'A ACHETÉ!
"There's a lot of luck to the game, as it is driven by card draws and dice. There's also a reasonable amount of strategy in choosing which player to have fight certain zombies, where to move and which paths to take. There are also a bunch of really, really thematically strange rules. Now, I don't mind more abstract games, but this is a game with tons of minis that should be brimming with theme. Many of the unthematic game elements are central to gameplay. This gives me the feeling that the game is about fighting arbitrary game mechanics, rather than fighting zombies."
93$ TMP (VF) 78$ IMG (EN) 65$ GG (EN)
